subject: Art & Design
title: Hierarchy: Guiding the Reader's Eye
description: A quick, practical guide to Hierarchy: Guiding the Reader's Eye.

hook.text: Your eye just skipped to the biggest text on this screen. That's typographic hierarchy doing its job.

buildup.text: Hierarchy uses size, weight, color, and spacing to signal what's most important and what's supporting.

discovery.text: Three levels usually suffice: headline (attention), subhead (context), and body (detail).

twist.text: If everything is bold, nothing is bold. Hierarchy only works when some elements are deliberately quiet.

climax.text: Squint at your design. If you can still tell what's most important, your hierarchy works.

punchline.text: Hierarchy doesn't shout louder. It whispers quieter everywhere else.
